intro: Dicalix japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and prefers moist, well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and branching. Dicalix japonica is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
